sentence.Network_en: There was a steep climb on the road out of town.
sentence.Network_cn: 市外公路上有一处很陡的上坡路.

entry.def: Out-of-town shops or facilities are situated away from the centre of a town or city.

example.tran: 在价格低廉的城郊超市购物

entry.def: Out-of-town is used to describe people who do not live in a particular town or city, but have travelled there for a particular purpose.

example.tran: 供外地来客下榻的豪华旅馆

means.word_mean: 1. happening in or being of another town or city;

auth_sentence.content: The notion would have been laughed out of town.
auth_sentence.res_content: The notion would have been laughed out of town.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The notion would have been laughed out of town.

auth_sentence.content: He helped me out of some pretty bad fire-fights.

auth_sentence.content: But it never feels out of control or flabby.
